summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding an ex parte submission to the court in the Epstein case. Bruce Barket sends a submission responding to appointed counsel's Curcio submission, requesting it be filed under seal, and later clarifies a request to disclose the submission to walled-off government counsel.

events.title: Ex parte submission preparation
events.description: Bruce Barket's legal team prepares a submission in response to appointed counsel's Curcio submission, intended to be filed ex parte and under seal.

events.title: Request for disclosure to walled-off counsel
events.description: A request is made for Bruce Barket to send a letter to the court authorizing disclosure of the ex parte submission to walled-off government counsel.

keyFacts: Attorneys are discussing an ex parte and under seal court submission related to the Epstein case, specifically a response to a Curcio submission from appointed counsel.
The exhibit folder for the submission is over 500 pages, indicating substantial documentation.
There is a procedural request to disclose the submission to 'walled-off Government counsel', suggesting separation within the prosecution team.
The correspondence involves multiple attorneys from different firms, indicating a coordinated legal effort.
The communication is marked as potentially privileged attorney-client communication, highlighting its confidential nature.
